thread.title: James Corden hints at bringing his US chat show to the UK
thread.title_full: James Corden hints at bringing his US chat show to the UK

author: Julia Hunt
title: James Corden hints at bringing his US chat show to the UK
text:
Celebs James Corden hints at bringing his US chat show to the UK The TV funnyman celebrates two years as host of CBS's The Late Late Show this month - but could Carpool Karaoke be coming to Britain's streets? Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Carpool Karaoke mega medley stars Adele, Gaga and more Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Comedian James Corden has hinted that he could bring his US chat show to the UK. 
The TV funnyman is about to celebrate his second anniversary as host of CBS's The Late Late Show, where his popular Carpool Karaoke feature finds him on the road with famous entertainers in the passenger seat as they sing hit songs. 
Discussing plans for the year in an interview with Radio Times, he teased: "We do have some stuff planned this year - which might involve being in the UK." 
Asked whether that means a home-grown version of the show or broadcasting from the UK, Corden, 38, said: "We're talking about it now, really. Read More James Corden has been a huge success in the US (Photo: CBS) Nick Kroll and Jordan Peele chat with Corden (Photo: CBS via Getty) 
"We don't know if we'll be able to get it together but it's certainly something I'd love to do, for sure." 
And if Corden does bring the programme across the pond, he already has a wish list of guests including Victoria and David Beckham and the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. 
"I don't know if they ever would but that would be terrific," he said of the royal couple. Read More This week's Radio Times is on sale from Tuesday, March 14. Like us on Facebook
